channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 7.1-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes China’s Tibet Region Near Nepal Border
item.description: Chinese state media said at least 95 people had died in the 7.1-magnitude quake near one of Tibet’s holiest cities. It was felt in neighboring Nepal.

item.title: Biden set to designate 2 new giant national monuments in California, protecting 850,000 acres as Trump looks to expand drilling
item.description: Tuesday's move will mean Biden has conserved more lands and waters than any other U.S. president, the White House said.

item.title: Justin Trudeau’s Trying to Save His Party. Is He Hurting Canada?
item.description: By suspending Parliament and promising to resign, the prime minister bought the Liberals time. But Canada will now face Donald J. Trump with a lame du...

item.title: The Next Congress
item.description: We explore the disagreements that could define the new Congress — and potentially derail Donald Trump’s agenda.

item.title: 7.1-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes China’s Tibet Region Near Nepal Border
item.description: Chinese state media said at least 95 people had died in the 7.1-magnitude quake near one of Tibet’s holiest cities. It was felt in neighboring Nepal.

item.title: How recruitment will change in 2025, according to top HR leaders from Hilton, PwC, and Ally Financial
item.description: Management will lean on AI and prioritize skills-based hiring to woo top talent.

item.title: Why Musk waded into U.K. child grooming gangs scandal
item.description: In a series of inflammatory tweets posted on his social media site X, the tech billionaire criticized PM Keir Starmer’s handling of so-called child gr...

item.title: For Many Returning Russian Veterans, a Long Road of Recovery Awaits
item.description: A large number of soldiers return as amputees, and many suffer from post-traumatic stress disorder. Once home, they face stigma and a grueling course ...

item.title: Drug Company to Share Revenues With Indigenous People Who Donated Their Genes
item.description: Variant Bio, a small biotech company based in Seattle, is using genetic information from Indigenous people to develop drugs for obesity and diabetes.

item.title: Biden administration says its ban on unpaid medical bills from appearing on credit reports could lead to 22,000 more mortgages each year
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris said in a statement announcing the rule that it would be “lifechanging” for millions of families.

item.title: Jean-Marie Le Pen, Rabble-Rousing Leader of French Far Right, Dies at 96
item.description: He ran unsuccessfully for the French presidency five times, riding waves of discontent and xenophobia as the leader of the National Front party.

item.title: The golden Christmas period was a huge boost for the U.K.’s biggest supermarkets Tesco and Sainsbury’s. But 2025’s storm clouds are brewing
item.description: The boom in spending was driven by average U.K. households making 17 shopping visits in December, according to Kantar data.

item.title: Educators Prepare for ICE Agents at the Schoolhouse Door
item.description: Across the country, educators described widespread anxiety about President-elect Donald J. Trump’s promises to deport immigrants and what it could mea...

item.title: Syria’s New Rebel Government Orders Changes to School Curriculum, Worrying Some Syrians
item.description: Syria’s new government has swiftly ordered changes to school curriculums. Some Syrians say the move is a worrying sign of how the former rebels plan t...

item.title: At a Beloved Lebanese Market, the ‘Destruction Is Painful’
item.description: Israeli raids pummeled the historic souk in the city of Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Residents and shop owners are only beginning to come to terms w...
